hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Neutral Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regime, when 10-day realized volatility for BTC drops below 60% (from >100%) while 1-day implied volatility remains above 80%, and BTC price breaks above its 5-day high on >10% volume spike, the regime will transition to NEUTRAL with BTC gaining >8% over 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression during stress periods with elevated implied vol suggests pent-up energy. Breakout on volume confirms institutional accumulation and regime normalization. Historical stress exits often follow this pattern.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility < 60% (down from >100% 5 days prior)
BTC price breaks 5-day high on volume > 10% above 20-day average

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price breaks below the 5-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to hold and volatility re-expands above 80% with price returning to range.
